polytech.devint.util.time

Class Timer

  • java.lang.Object
    • polytech.devint.scheduler.SchedulerReady
      • polytech.devint.util.time.Timer

  • public abstract class Timer
extends SchedulerReady
    Represent a generic timer
    Author:
    Loris Friedel

    • Constructor Detail

      • Timer

        public Timer(long duration,
             long interval)
        Parameters:
        duration - The period in milliseconds for which the timer should run. After this time has passed, the timer will stop.
        interval - The time gap between each tick in milliseconds.

      • Timer

        public Timer(long duration)
        This constructor uses the default interval : 10 ms
        Parameters:
        duration - The period in milliseconds for which the timer should run. After this time has passed, the timer will stop.

    • Method Detail

      • isReady

        public boolean isReady()
        Returns:
        True if the timer is ready to be started, after a reset or if it was never started, false otherwise.

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Returns:
        True if the timer is currently running, false otherwise.

      • isPaused

        public boolean isPaused()
        Returns:
        True if the timer is currently paused, false otherwise.

      • hasFinished

        public boolean hasFinished()
        Returns:
        True if the timer run for its total duration without being canceled, false otherwise.

      • hasBeenCanceled

        public boolean hasBeenCanceled()
        Returns:
        True if the timer has been canceled and is not yet ready, false otherwise.

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the timer. If the timer was already running, this call is ignored.

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Paused the timer. The timer can be resume after being paused. If the timer is not running, this call is ignored.

      • resume

        public void resume()
        Resumes the timer if it was paused, else does nothing

      • cancel

        public void cancel()
        Stop the timer and reset it. This method can only be called if the timer is running or paused. If the timer is not running and already ready to use, then this call does nothing.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Reset the timer. If the timer is running, this method does nothing. This method can only be used if the timer has finished or has been canceled. After a call of this method, the timer will be ready to use again.

      • restart

        public void restart()
        Restart the timer. The elapsed time is set to 0 and the timer is started after being cancelled.

      • onStart

        protected void onStart()
        This method is called when the timer is started. (the call happens right after the timer is started)

      • onTick

        protected void onTick()
        This method is called periodically with the interval set as the delay between subsequent calls. (the call happens right before the check of the end of the timer)

      • onFinish

        protected void onFinish()
        This method is called once the timer has run for the specified duration and has not been canceled. (the call happens right after the timer ended)

      • getElapsedTime

        public long getElapsedTime()
        Returns:
        The elapsed time (in milliseconds) since the start of the timer.

      • getRemainingTime

        public long getRemainingTime()
        Returns:
        The time remaining (in milliseconds) for the timer to stop.
